name: ASP 2025 + Calendar — Fort Greene Park Conservancy

events.title: Alternate Side Parking Suspended
events.description: Alternate Side Parking suspended for Christmas Day. Parking meters will not be in effect. Stopping, standing and parking are permitted, except in areas where stopping, standing and parking rules are in effect seven days a week (for example, “No  Standing Anytime”).

events.title: NYC Big Spring Clean
events.description: We're excited to join forces with the Sanitation Foundation to help power one of NYC's biggest volunteer litter cleanups ever. This community-based event is part of the NYC Big Spring Clean - a citywide initiative to create a cleaner and more sustainable city for all New Yorkers. Throughout April and May, you can join over 150 cleanups and activities through the five boroughs. Step up and clean up!

events.title: Black History And Culture Tour Of Fort Greene
events.description: Join us for the Black History and Culture of Fort Greene Tour led by historian Suzanne Spellen with a special tour spot at Brooklyn Paramount. Working together with Spellen and the Tour Advisory Committee, we develop and refine the route and educational content to help retell Fort Greene’s deep roots in Black history and culture for a personal, on-the-ground look at this important historical context.Meet us for this free event at the Fort Greene Park entrance at the corner of Dekalb Avenue and Washington Park.

events.title: Shala Yoga
events.description: Join Shala Yoga in Fort Greene Park on the Eastern Panel of the Monument.

events.title: Living Well, Living Strong: Free Health Fest and Fun Beats
events.description: It's the health event of the year for the community as Brooklyn Community Board 2 brings you "Living Well, Living Strong, Free Health Fest and Fun Beats! Get your services, get tested, and get ready for a fun day in the park! There will be music, free healthy food, a prostate screening truck (free PSA blood test!, not invasive), a DJ, medical professionals on site with practical services, blood pressure testing, a panel discussion on maternal health, kids' activities, and so much more! Rain Date: May 31

events.title: AMP'd Class with Chelsea Piers Fitness
events.description: Hit the grass and push your body to new limits with Chelsea Pier’s Coach Declan Julien at the top of Fort Greene Park, right next to the monument! This free, high-intensity interval training class will challenge your body and boost your energy with a mix of bodyweight strength and cardio exercises.All levels are welcome to join. Please bring your own mat or towel, as those will not be provided, and be prepared with water, sunblock and anything you need to remain comfortable in the sun.

events.title: Storytime in the Park
events.description: Sing, read, and play with librarians from Brooklyn Public Library! Have fun hearing great picture books read aloud and playing with other children during this program featuring guest musical artists from Urban Stages. For children of all ages and their caregivers.

events.title: Chinese and Spanish Language Film Series: Comrades: Almost a love story
events.description: Join us on the Myrtle Lawn for our free Chinese and Spanish Language Film Series, which showcases a Chinese or Spanish language film for Fort Greene’s Taishanese and Spanish-speaking residents to enjoy. Seating is first come, first served.

events.description: Join Shala Yoga in Fort Greene Park on the Eastern Panel of the Monument.

events.title: Chinese and Spanish Language Film SerieS: In The Mood For Love
events.description: Due to projected rain, we are moving forward with the rain date Thursday, May 29. Join us on the Myrtle Lawn for our free Chinese and Spanish Language Film Series, which showcases a Chinese or Spanish language film for Fort Greene’s Taishanese and Spanish-speaking residents to enjoy. Seating is first come, first served.
